title: 114_s2211
content: The "Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015" allows for additional uses of the Spectrum Relocation Fund. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows for additional payments for research and development and planning activities, appropriating up to $500,000,000 from the Fund for such purposes. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 authorizes the Director of OMB to use up to 10 percent of the amounts deposited in the Fund for research, development, and planning activities to improve spectrum use efficiency by Federal entities. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows for the reallocation of federal spectrum for auction, with payments for systems that enhance federal spectrum use efficiency and effectiveness. This includes systems that increase functionality, accommodate spectrum sharing with non-federal entities, and consolidate functions or services. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows for payments to federal entities for activities using frequencies not designated for auction, subject to conditions set by the Director of OMB. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows federal entities to receive payments for activities using non-auctioned frequencies, subject to approval by the Technical Panel and submission to congressional committees by the Director of OMB. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows federal entities to receive payments for activities using non-auctioned frequencies, subject to approval by the Technical Panel within 120 days of submission of the plan. The Technical Panel will review the plan and consider the activities the Federal entity will conduct with the payment. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows federal entities to receive payments to increase the likelihood of spectrum relocation or sharing, facilitate auctions within 8 years, and boost auction proceeds. The transfer must ensure enough funds remain in the Fund. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows federal entities to receive payments for spectrum relocation or sharing. The Director of OMB prioritizes payments under subsection (g). Administrative support for the Technical Panel is expanded to include section 118(g)(2)(E). Eligible federal entities can relocate and share spectrum. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows eligible federal entities to relocate and share spectrum, with amendments to the National Telecommunications and Information Administration Organization Act. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows federal entities to share spectrum frequencies, including the costs incurred by incumbent Federal entities for accommodating sharing. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows federal entities to share spectrum frequencies and relocate operations from eligible frequencies. The Act also amends Section 118 of the National Telecommunications and Information Administration Organization Act to address relocation and sharing of frequencies for incumbent Federal entities. The Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015 allows federal entities to share spectrum frequencies with a Federal entity relocating operations from eligible frequencies. This amendment addresses sharing and relocation of frequencies for incumbent Federal entities.
